abstracts.cdata!:
The Road Maintenance Project in Sri
            Lanka was successful. The Bank contributed significantly
            during project identification and preparation, and
            particularly in the preparatory work of the project. As
            stated earlier, the Bank made several periodic reviews of
            project implementation. These comments and recommendations
            have been very helpful. It was most helpful in that some of
            the reviewing staff have been also responsible for project
            appraisal and preparation. The project was successful in
            improving periodic maintenance of the trunk road network
            including bridges and in strengthening the institutions
            concerned with transport infrastructure. Sound maintenance
            and substantial rehabilitation were an urgent need to
            prevent further serious deterioration. Hence, the assessment
            of the Highway sector problems and priorities, and the
            resultant project of road maintenance and rehabilitation,
            has been appropriate and very useful.

docna.cdata!:
Sri Lanka - Road Maintenance Project :
            Credit 0900 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Sri Lanka - Road Maintenance
            Project : Credit 0900 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
The project aims to improve the highway
            system of Sri Lanka by a program of enhanced routine and
            periodic maintenance, thereby reducing transport costs. The
            project would provide for rehabilitation and limited
            improvement of 112 miles of road; resealing or resurfacing
            of about 150 additional miles; strengthening, repair or
            replacement of 30 bridges and procurement of road
            maintenance and workshop equipment. The project would also
            strengthen the road maintenance services of the Department
            of Highways and lay the foundation for improved routine and
            periodic maintenance.
